evidence.text:
COUNT ONE
Violation of the Administrative Procedure Act—§ 706(2)(A)
Arbitrary and Capricious
(Against All Defendants)

extracted.value: Violation of the Administrative Procedure Act—§ 706(2)(A) – Arbitrary and Capricious

evidence.text:
COUNT THREE
Ultra Vires
(Against All Defendants)

COUNT FOUR
Separation of Powers
(Against All Defendants)
a. Declare unlawful Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program, including but not limited to the issuance of termination and non-renewal notices by DOL starting May 29, 2025;

extracted.value: Declare unlawful Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program, including issuance of termination and non-renewal notices by DOL starting May 29, 2025

evidence.text: b. Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are arbitrary and capricious, in excess of statutory authority, and a violation of the Administrative Procedure Act;

extracted.value: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are arbitrary and capricious, in excess of statutory authority, and a violation of the Administrative Procedure Act

evidence.text: c. Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are ultra vires;

extracted.value: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are ultra vires

evidence.text: d. Declare  that  Defendants’  actions  eliminating  the  Job  Corps  program  violate  the  separation  of  powers;

extracted.value: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program violate the separation of powers

evidence.text: e. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025;

extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025

evidence.text: f. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals;

extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals

evidence.text: g. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization;

extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization

evidence.text: h. Award  Plaintiffs  costs,  reasonable  attorneys’  fees,  and  other  disbursements  as  appropriate;

extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs costs, reasonable attorneys’ fees, and other disbursements as appropriate

evidence.text: i. Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.

extracted.value: Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper

U.S. Const. art. I, § 8
U.S. Const. art. I, § 9, cl. 7
U.S. Const. art. I, § 8, cl. 1
